etymologies: mid 17th century: from Latin foedus, foeder- ‘league, covenant’+ -al

definitions: having or relating to a system of government in which several states form a unity but remain independent in internal affairs

examples.text: Russia's federation treaty shares powers among Russia's federal and local governments

shortDefinitions: having or relating to system of government in which several states form unity but remain independent in internal affairs

definitions: relating to or denoting the central government as distinguished from the separate units constituting a federation

examples.text: the federal agency that provides legal services to the poor

shortDefinitions: of, relating to, or denoting central government as distinguished from separate units constituting federation

definitions: relating to or denoting the central government of the US.
shortDefinitions: of, relating to, or denoting central government of US

definitions: of the northern states in the Civil War

examples.text: a loud Federal cheer was heard, proving Stonewall to be hard pressed

shortDefinitions: of northern states in Civil War
